thread.title: Hawks remain perfect in preseason, beating Spurs 100-86
thread.title_full: Hawks remain perfect in preseason, beating Spurs 100-86

author: The Associated Press
title: Hawks remain perfect in preseason, beating Spurs 100-86
text:
By The Associated Press Related Articles Hawks hope getting bigger will address most glaring weakness Sefolosha returns to Hawks, hoping to move on after arrest Hawks hope to improve on trip to Eastern Conference final Atlanta mayor mulling plan to upgrade or replace Hawks arena 
ATLANTA (AP) â€” Jeff Teague scored 19 points and the Hawks remained perfect in the preseason, beating the San Antonio Spurs 100-86 Wednesday night in Atlanta's first home game since the Eastern Conference final. 
The Hawks (3-0) took control with an 11-0 spurt late in the third quarter, handing the winless Spurs their third straight defeat. 
SPURS: F LaMarcus Aldridge (back spasms) did not play. Matt Bonner started in his place. ... Kawhi Leonard scored a game-high 20 points. 
HAWKS: F Thabo Sefolosha played his first game since April, when his right leg was broken in an encounter with New York police. He had 5 points in 8 minutes. 
STAR WATCH: Thirty-nine-year Tim Duncan played only 13 minutes for the Spurs, scoring 4 points. He didn't return after halftime. 
UP NEXT: The Spurs are back home Sunday to host the Detroit Pistons. The Hawks travel to Dallas to face the Mavericks on Friday. The Associated Press The Associated Press is an American multinational nonprofit news agency headquartered in New York City. The AP is owned by its contributing newspapers, radio, and television stations in the United States, all of which contribute stories to the AP and use material written by its staff journalists.
